file_insights.file_purpose: Base English translation file for i18n implementation
file_insights.content_structure: Nested JSON object with 16 top-level sections organizing translations by functional domain

patterns_discovered.description: Translations organized into logical sections (common, buttons, pages, header, sidebar, errors, etc.) for maintainability and scalability
camelCase keys used throughout with compound names for related items (e.g., 'createSuccess', 'failedToLoad')
Interpolation syntax using {{variable}} for dynamic content (e.g., 'Welcome, {{name}}', 'View all {{count}} items')
Complete coverage of common UI elements, buttons, form fields, status states, and error messages
Distinct sections for each major application feature: projects, equipment, materials, meetings, approvals, areas, contacts, audit
Language selection capability included with English and Hebrew translations referenced

gotchas_discovered.description: Some keys appear in multiple sections (e.g., 'delete', 'description', 'location' appear in both common/buttons and page-specific sections), which could complicate maintenance and updates
Status values use mixed naming conventions: some use snake_case ('in_progress', 'on_hold') while others use camelCase or title case, reducing consistency
Notification templates use variable interpolation but lack clear documentation on expected variable names and types passed from components
Only one form provided for items like 'View all {{count}} items' without specification for singular/plural differentiation logic

approach_outcome.objective: Establish foundation for internationalization with comprehensive English translation file
approach_outcome.execution: Created well-structured JSON translation file with 274 lines organized into 16 semantic sections covering all major application features and UI elements
deliverables: Base English locale file with comprehensive vocabulary

recommendations.recommendation: Consolidate duplicate translation keys by removing redundant entries from 'buttons' section and referencing them from 'common' section to reduce maintenance overhead
Standardize status naming in the 'status' section to use consistent casing (recommend snake_case for all compound words: 'in_progress', 'on_hold')
Create a translation key reference document specifying required variable names for interpolation templates (e.g., {{name}}, {{count}}, {{date}}, {{time}})
Implement plural handling mechanism (e.g., using i18next pluralization) before creating translations for languages with complex plural rules
Establish translation management system or tool (e.g., Crowdin, Lokalise) to manage concurrent translations for Hebrew and future language additions
Add validation tests to ensure all interpolation variables are provided by components and all translation keys are referenced in codebase
